intro: Phoradendron prancei, commonly known as the Prance's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees, primarily in the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Viscaceae family and relies on its host for water and some nutrients, while it produces its own food through photosynthesis. The plant has small, scale-like leaves and produces white or yellowish flowers that are typically pollinated by insects. Its berries are red or orange and serve as a food source for various bird species, contributing to seed dispersal.
